## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

```{r}
library(lubridate)
```
```{r}
tpeTime <- ymd_hms("2020-03-18 13:52:40",
        tz="Asia/Taipei")
tpeTime
```
```{r}
pgTime <- mdy_hms("Mar.18, 2020, 05:52:40",
                  tz="Europe/Lisbon")
pgTime
```
```{r}
class(tpeTime)
typeof(tpeTime)
as.double(tpeTime)
```
```{r}
with_tz(tpeTime, tzone="UTC")
with_tz(pgTime, tzone="UTC")
```
```{r}
with_tz(tpeTime, tzone="Europe/Paris")
with_tz(pgTime, tzone="Europe/Paris")
```
```{r}
tpeTime <- 
  ymd_hms(
    c("2020-03-18 13:52:40","2020-03-11 03:12:40"),
    tz="Asia/Taipei"
    )
tpeTime
```
```{r}
utcTime <- ymd_hms("2020-03-04T06:47:39Z")
with_tz(
  utcTime,
  tzone = "Asia/Taipei"
)

```
```{r}
stuTime <- c(
  ymd_hms("2020-03-04T06:47:39Z"),
  ymd_hms(
    c("2020-03-11 14:30:28","2020-03-11 14:30:28"),tzone = "Asia/Taipei")
)
stuTime
```

```{r}
c("小明","2020-03-31T13:40:55Z","一芳","2杯","水果茶")
```
```{r}
`小明交易1` <- list(
  ymd_hms("2020-03-31T13:40:55Z"), # Date/Time class
  "一芳", # character
  2, # numeric
  "水果茶" # character
)
print(`小明交易1`)
```

)
print(`小明108學年課表A`)
